name: Angelita Waters
review: Stephen Galloway writes about one of the 20th century's most glamorous couples, training an eye on Leigh's mental health struggles. I absolutely recommend this read. It's light hearted and a delight!

name: Vincent Cunningham
review: “The Trayvon Generation” traces the influences of racism and violence on American culture today. You deserve all the wonderful things in the world, Nova. I'm not it

name: Huber Howell
review: In this un-put-downable romance, Madden-Mills skillfully balances the emotional with the physical to produce a love story that's equal parts scorching and sweet.

name: Cornelia Avery
review: You deserve all the wonderful things in the world, Nova. I'm not it. I want to touch the stars, even if I get burned.

name: Vivian Walsh
review: I absolutely loved this book. Nova has moved back home to the small town Blue Belle to take care of her sister after their mom died. Nova's neighbor the high school football coach is having a party that's disrupting Nova.

name: Ruthie Flynn
review: You can always guarantee a great read with this author, she sucks you in immediately and will always leave you with a smile.
